dcterms:creator: V.-I. Ilie
C.-O. TruicÄƒ
E.-S. Apostol
A. Paschke
dcterms:description: The Fake News Corpus (FNC) dataset contains over 9.4 million articles labeled using 11 predefined labels. A balanced subset of 20,000 articles tagged as either reliable or fake was chosen for the study.
dcterms:title: Fake News Corpus (FNC)

dcterms:creator: M. Mayank
S. Sharma
R. Sharma
dcterms:description: The Kaggle dataset, downloaded from the Kaggle Fake News Detection challenge, consists of 20,800 articles tagged as reliable or unreliable. After eliminating null rows, the resulting dataset consists of 10,387 reliable and 10,374 unreliable tagged news.
dcterms:title: Kaggle

dcterms:creator: K. Shu
D. Mahudeswaran
S. Wang
D. Lee
H. Liu
dcterms:description: The GossipCop dataset consists of 22,155 news titles, article URLs, tweet IDs of users that retweeted the article, and tags that label articles as true or fake. A balanced subset of 5,323 articles representing both tags was selected for the study.
dcterms:title: GossipCop

dcterms:creator: K. Nakamura
S. Levy
W. Y. Wang
dcterms:description: Fakeddit is a multimodal dataset that allows 2-way, 3-way, or 6-way classification using images, text, or both. The study used the title of the post and the 2-way label to perform the task, selecting 107,742 posts with a 1:1 true-to-fake ratio.
dcterms:title: Fakeddit

dcterms:creator: X. Liu
A. Nourbakhsh
Q. Li
R. Fang
S. Shah
dcterms:description: The Twitter15 dataset contains news articles and their labels, along with information on the directed network structure among users, followers, and followees. It consists of 1,490 news articles labeled as true, unverified, non-rumor, or false, with 361 articles identified as false used for analysis.
dcterms:title: Twitter15
